articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Many killed in attack on military camp in Libya’s capital: minister
articles.description: At least 28 people were killed in an attack on a military academy in the Libyan capital late on Saturday, the health minister of the Tripoli-based government said.
articles.content:
Tripoli (Reuters) - At least 28 people were killed in an attack on a military academy in the Libyan capital late on Saturday, the health minister of the Tripoli-based government said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Fires rage out of control in southeast Australia
articles.description: Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia's east coast on Saturday, fanned by high temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property, as a change in wind conditions merged several large fire fronts.
articles.content:
Posted 
Bushfires burned dangerously out of control on Australia's east coast on Saturday, fanned by high temperatures and strong winds that had firefighters battling to save lives and property, as a change in wind conditions merged several large fire fronts.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S.-led coalition confirms attacks on Iraqi bases housing its troops
articles.description: The United States-led military coalition fighting Islamic State said early on Sunday that there were two attacks near Iraqi bases housing its troops on Saturday night but that none of its troops were harmed.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The United States-led military coalition fighting Islamic State said early on Sunday that there were two attacks near Iraqi bases housing its troops on Saturday night but that none of its troops were harmed.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australian bushfires ease on cooler weather, death toll rises
articles.description: A weather change eased fire threats in southeastern Australia on Sunday after a horror day of blazes that killed one man and injured four firefighters, though authorities said risks remained with a number of fires burning at emergency levels.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Venezuelan Dudamel named Atletico Mineiro coach
articles.description: Venezuelan Rafael Dudamel was given a two-year contract to coach Brazilian club Atletico Mineiro on Saturday, two days after he resigned as head of Venezuela's national team.
articles.content:
RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) - Venezuelan Rafael Dudamel was given a two-year contract to coach Brazilian club Atletico Mineiro on Saturday, two days after he resigned as head of Venezuela’s national team. 
Dudamel, who becomes the 12th foreign manager to take c… [+854 chars]

articles.title: Austrian foreign ministry says fighting cyberattack
articles.description: Austria's foreign ministry is facing a serious cyberattack, possibly from a foreign country, it said on Saturday.
articles.content:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Austria’s foreign ministry is facing a serious cyberattack, possibly from a foreign country, it said on Saturday. 
“Due to the severity and the nature of the attack, it cannot be ruled out that it is a targeted attack by a state actor. In … [+498 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Royal family sends messages of support to fire-ravaged Australia
articles.description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth joined grandsons William and Harry on Saturday in expressing shock at the bushfires ravaging Australia, and sent their thanks to the firefighters who risked their lives to save others.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain’s Queen Elizabeth joined grandsons William and Harry on Saturday in expressing shock at the bushfires ravaging Australia, and sent their thanks to the firefighters who risked their lives to save others.

articles.title: Starmer launches bid for leadership of Labour Party
articles.description: Keir Starmer, a former senior public prosecutor, launched his bid to replace Jeremy Corbyn as the leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party on Saturday with a defence of his efforts to stand up for "the powerless and against the powerful".
